job.name: Database_Sequential_Queries

variable.name: RDBMS_NAME
variable.model: PA:LIST(postgresql, mysql, greenplum, sqlserver, oracle, hsqldb)
variable.description: The relational database management system name e.g. postgresql, mysql, greenplum, hsqldb, oracle...

variable.name: DATABASE
variable.description: The database name

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the database host machine. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the database

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: Database user name

variable.name: CREDENTIALS_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: POOL_autoCommit
variable.description: HikariCP offers many data source properties that can be used to configure the DB pooled connection such as autoCommit, maximumPoolSize, maxLifetime, idleTimeout .... You can add as many properties as you want. For each one, add a new task variable where the variable name is the property name having POOL_ as a prefix (e.g. POOL_autoCommit, POOL_maximumPoolSize) and the variable value is the property value. For more info, please refer to HikariCP documentation.

variable.name: OUTPUT_TYPE
variable.description: Format of the output (CSV or HTML)

job.description: This workflow is a template that demonstrates how to create a table, populate this table then select some data in a sequential manner. The select query result (converted into a List of Maps) can be stored in a dedicated variable called `STORE_RESULT_VARIABLE`. This variable can be used in other tasks. The java doc can be found at <https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/ResultSet.html>

task.name: Select_Data
task.description: This task allows to open a pooled connection to any SQL database and then execute any SQL query statements on it. If it requires a password, you have to add it using the following third-party credential: {key: rdbms_name://<username>@<host>:<port>, value: RDBMS_PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. This task has the same list of workflow variables.

variable.name: RDBMS_NAME
variable.model: PA:LIST(postgresql, mysql, greenplum, sqlserver, oracle, hsqldb)
variable.description: The relational database management system name e.g. postgresql, mysql, greenplum, hsqldb, oracle...

variable.name: DATABASE
variable.description: The database name

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the database host machine. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the database

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: Database user name

variable.name: CREDENTIALS_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: POOL_autoCommit
variable.description: HikariCP offers many data source properties that can be used to configure the DB pooled connection such as autoCommit, maximumPoolSize, maxLifetime, idleTimeout .... You can add as many properties as you want. For each one, add a new task variable where the variable name is the property name having POOL_ as a prefix (e.g. POOL_autoCommit, POOL_maximumPoolSize) and the variable value is the property value. For more info, please refer to HikariCP documentation.

variable.name: SQL_STATEMENTS
variable.description: A string composed of a set of query statements (SELECT statement)

variable.name: OUTPUT_TYPE
variable.description: Format of the output (CSV or HTML)

variable.name: STORE_RESULT_VARIABLE
variable.description: The name of a workflow variable that will contain the result set (SQL query result converted into a List of HashMaps). This variable can be used in children tasks. The java documentation of the ResultSet class can be found here

task.name: Create_Table
task.description: This task allows to open a pooled connection to any SQL database and then execute any SQL update statements on it. If it requires a password, you have to add it using the following third-party credential: {key: rdbms_name://<username>@<host>:<port>, value: RDBMS_PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. This task has the same list of workflow variables.

variable.name: RDBMS_NAME
variable.model: PA:LIST(postgresql, mysql, greenplum, sqlserver, oracle, hsqldb)
variable.description: The relational database management system name e.g. postgresql, mysql, greenplum, hsqldb, oracle...

variable.name: DATABASE
variable.description: The database name

variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the database host machine. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the database

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: Database user name

variable.name: CREDENTIALS_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: POOL_autoCommit
variable.description: HikariCP offers many data source properties that can be used to configure the DB pooled connection such as autoCommit, maximumPoolSize, maxLifetime, idleTimeout .... You can add as many properties as you want. For each one, add a new task variable where the variable name is the property name having POOL_ as a prefix (e.g. POOL_autoCommit, POOL_maximumPoolSize) and the variable value is the property value. For more info, please refer to HikariCP documentation

variable.name: SQL_STATEMENTS
variable.value: CREATE TABLE employees (employee_id NUMERIC NOT NULL, first_name VARCHAR(1000) NOT NULL, last_name VARCHAR(1000) NOT NULL, date_of_birth DATE, phone_number VARCHAR(1000) NOT NULL, CONSTRAINT employees_pk PRIMARY KEY (employee_id))
variable.description: A string composed of a set of update statements (CREATE, INSERT , UPDATE , or DELETE statement)

task.name: Insert_Data
task.description: This task allows to open a pooled connection to any SQL database and then execute any SQL update statements on it. If it requires a password, you have to add it using the following third-party credential: {key: rdbms_name://<username>@<host>:<port>, value: RDBMS_PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials. This task has the same list of workflow variables.

You can add as many properties as you want. For each one, add a new task variable where the variable name is the property name having POOL_ as a prefix (e.g. POOL_autoCommit, POOL_maximumPoolSize) and the variable value is the property value. variable.name: SQL_STATEMENTS
variable.value: INSERT INTO employees (employee_id, first_name, last_name, date_of_birth, phone_number) VALUES (1, 'Smith', 'Holmes', '01-01-2000', '11111111'), (2, 'Albert', 'Bolt', '02-02-2000', '22222222'), (3, 'Caroline', 'Avinash', '03-03-2000', '33333333'), (4, 'Lilia', 'Cook', '04-04-2000', '44444444')
variable.description: A string composed of a set of update statements (CREATE, INSERT , UPDATE , or DELETE statement)
